page.title: 12Brook church
page.content: Brook Church is a small Norman Church. It was built in the eleventh century by the monks of Christchurch in Canterbury. It has avery big square tower with three bells. It has one decorated window and two early English one. The rest of the windows are Norman. The most famous thing in the church is the wall paintings. People come from other countries to look at those. The ones in the chancel are done in black on white or white on black. In one wall of the chancel there is a squint, which is a hole in the wall with a little door over it. In Norman times a hermit probably had a little hut outside this and he could look through and watch the service.
